item.title: From Hand-Crafted HTML to Hugo: A Migration Story
item.description:
For years, I’ve been that developer—the one who hand-codes everything. My portfolio site was a labor of love: custom HTML with semantic structure, 2,132 lines of carefully crafted CSS celebrating my Norwegian and Portuguese heritage, and JavaScript that brought personality to every scroll and click. But as a Chief Architect who preaches modern tooling to clients, I knew I was living in a glass house.

It was time to practice what I preach. Enter Hugo, the blazing-fast static site generator, and GitHub Copilot, my tireless co-pilot through the migration journey.
